derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent. (as a term in philosophy): from Greek eklektikos, from eklegein 'pick out', from ek 'out' + legein 'choose'

entry.tran: 兼收并蓄的;五花八门的;不拘一格的
entry.def: An eclectic collection of objects, ideas, or beliefs is wide-ranging and comes from many different sources.

example.ex: ...an eclectic collection of paintings, drawings, and prints.
